      Point3D add(Point3D gps, Point3D local_vector_in_meter)

      double[] azimuth_elevation_dist(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      computes the polar representation of the 3D vector be gps0-->gps1 Note: this method should return an azimuth (aka yaw), elevation (pitch), and distance
      double distance3d(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      computes the 3D distance (in meters) between the two gps like points
      boolean isValid_GPS_Point(Point3D p)
      return true iff this point is a valid lat, lon , lat coordinate: [-180,+180],[-90,+90],[-450, +inf]
      Point3D vector3D(Point3D gps0, Point3D gps1)
      computes the 3D vector (in meters) between two gps like points
